page.title: 06EDUCATION - A DAY IN SCHOOL
page.content: Some children walk to school, but others come in the family car. After reading for a while we have assembly, and one class talked about a farm they had visited. On Thursdays the vicar comes to tell us a story. After assembly we do spellings or maths, such as adding, taking away, times and division. We have a computer on which we take turns to use. In activities we do woodwork, sewing, boxcraft, clay collage, painting,and gardening. Woodwork is the favourite. At 10.30 we go out to play. Some children play ball games, others play on the climbing frame or with toy ponies. All the children stay in school for dinner some have a cooked meal, others bring sandwiches. We sometimes watch schools television programmes. In music lesson we sing, play percussion instruments, and some of us play a recorder.
